item.title: Research Notes on Humanoid Robots
item.description: After Elon’s announcement of the Tesla Bot [1], many people mocked the silly on-stage presentation and joked about the forever Level-5 Tesla Autopilot. The last time when humanoid robots caught my eye was the Honda Asimo, when I was a kid. I saved money to buy Robosapien the toy because that was the only bipedal humanoid robot toy available.

item.title: What’s new in .NET Productivity with Visual Studio 2022
item.description: With the release of Visual Studio 2022 the Roslyn team continues to enhance your .NET developer productivity with the latest tooling improvements. In this post I’ll cover the following .NET productivity enhancements: Source Link navigation Stack Trace Explorer Naming styles in the EditorConfig UI Sync namespaces from Solution Explorer IntelliSense completion for await New code fixes and refactorings Navigation and code exploration Navigating and exploring code is an integral part of developer productivity.

item.title: Migrating from ASP.NET Core 5.0 MVC app to 6.0
item.description: This post is about how to update an existing ASP.NET Core 5.0 MVC project to ASP.NET Core 6.0. I am sharing my experience while upgrading one of .NET 5.0 project to the .NET 6.0. First we need to upgrade TargetFramework element in the csproj file from net5.0 to net6.0. We can enable other .NET 6.0 framework features as well, like Nullable and ImplicitUsings.

item.title: Building an Async HTTP Api with Azure Durable Functions and Python
item.description: The async HTTP API pattern addresses the problem of coordinating the state of long-running operations with external clients. Azure Durable Functions provides built-in support for this pattern and in this post I'm going to show you how to implement it using Python.
